trans-unit.source: Defines static methods for creating Federation Metadata documents and for updating application configuration based on Federation Metadata documents.

For more information about Federation Metadata documents, see section three of the following specification: [Web Services Federation Language (WS-Federation) Version 1.2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=210152) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=210152).
Creates an XML document that contains Federation Metadata.
The application URI.
The X.509 certificate to use to sign the metadata.
The claims required by the application.
One of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.ApplicationType"></xref> values that specifies the type of application that the metadata describes.
This is used to determine the endpoints to create.
The collection of acceptable URIs that can be used for this application.
An XML reader that contains the metadata document that was created by using the parameters.
Updates the specified application configuration, if needed, based on the specified Federation Metadata document and a value that specifies whether the claims offered list should be updated.
An XML reader that contains the metadata document.
An XML reader that contains the configuration.
`true` if the claims offered list should be updated; otherwise, `false`.
An XML reader that contains the updated configuration or `null` if the configuration could not be updated.
metadataReader is `null`.
-or-
inputConfiguration is `null`.
Updates the specified application configuration, if needed, based on the specified Federation Metadata document and a value that specifies whether the claims offered list should be updated.
The serializer with which to read the security token service (STS) metadata is also specified.
An XML reader that contains the metadata document.
An XML reader that contains the configuration.
`true` if the claims offered list should be updated; otherwise, `false`.
The serializer with which to read the STS metadata.
An XML reader that contains the updated configuration or `null` if the configuration could not be updated.
metadataReader is `null`.
-or-
inputConfiguration is `null`.
-or-
metadataSerializer is `null`.
Updates the specified application configuration, if needed, based on the specified Federation Metadata document.
Returns the configuration elements for the issuer name registry, as well as the configuration elements for the updated list of claims types offered, if it has been updated.
An XML reader that contains the metadata document.
An XML reader that contains the configuration.
When this method returns, contains an XML node reader that contains the elements that specify the issuer name registry.
`null` if there are is no issuer name registry specified.
This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
When this method returns, if the list of claim types offered has been changed, contains an XML node reader that contains elements that specify new list.
If the list has not been changed, returns `null`.
This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
metadataReader is `null`.
-or-
inputConfigurationmetadataReader is `null`.
Updates the specified application configuration, if needed, based on the specified Federation Metadata document.
Returns configuration elements for the issuer name registry, as well as the configuration elements for the updated list of claims types offered, if it has been updated.
The serializer with which to read the security token service (STS) metadata is also specified.
An XML reader that contains the metadata document.
An XML reader that contains the configuration.
When this method returns, contains an XML node reader that contains the elements that specify the issuer name registry.
`null` if there are is no issuer name registry specified.
This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
When this method returns, if the list of claim types offered has been changed, contains an XML node reader that contains elements that specify new list.
If the list has not been changed, returns `null`.
This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
The serializer with which to read the STS metadata.
metadataReader is `null`.
-or-
inputConfiguration is `null`.
-or-
metadataSerializer is `null`.
